FuncDef:
The match-type vxlan-qos-local-id enable command enables the QoS policy ID matching mode for VXLAN packets.
The undo match-type vxlan-qos-local-id enable command disables the QoS policy ID matching mode for VXLAN packets.
By default, the QoS policy ID matching mode is disabled for VXLAN packets.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
Before configuring a matching rule based on a QoS policy ID in VXLAN packets in a traffic policy, run the match-type vxlan-qos-local-id enable command to enable the QoS policy ID matching mode for VXLAN packets. If the command is not run, the matching rule does not take effect.
Precautions
This command can be configured only in the traffic policy where traffic behaviors and classifiers are not associated.
This command cannot be configured repeatedly in the same traffic policy.
After this command is configured in a traffic policy, the traffic policy cannot be configured with layer-related parameters.
After this command is configured in a traffic policy, the traffic policy can be applied only to common interfaces/sub-interfaces, trunk interfaces/sub-interfaces, and Layer 2 interfaces.
This command and its undo form cannot be configured in a traffic policy that has been applied to an interface.
This command is supported only on the CR5D0EKGFA72, CR5DNKFEDY71, CR5D0EKXFC70, CR5D0EKGFC70, CR5DNKFEDY70, CR5D0EKGFA71, CR5DNKFEDY72.
